Validate Data and Metadata Files

Source: R/stage_wrappers.R
fileValidation.Rd

This function performs a series of validation checks on data and metadata files.

Usage

fileValidation(
  datafilename,
  metafilename,
  dataseparator,
  metaseparator,
  datafile,
  metafile
)

Arguments

datafilename

A string representing the name of the data file.

metafilename

A string representing the name of the metadata file.

dataseparator

A string representing the separator used in the data file.

metaseparator

A string representing the separator used in the metadata file.

datafile

A data frame containing the data file content.

metafile

A data frame containing the metadata file content.

Value

A tibble with the results of the validation checks.

Details

The function performs the following validation checks:

  • Checks for spaces in the data and metadata filenames.

  • Checks for special characters in the data and metadata filenames.

  • Ensures naming conventions are followed for the data and metadata filenames.

  • Converts rows to columns for comparison between data and metadata files.

  • Validates the file separators used in the data and metadata files.

  • Checks for empty rows in the data and metadata files.

  • Checks for empty columns in the data file.

  • Ensures mandatory columns are present in the data and metadata files.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
datafile <- read.csv("data.csv")
metafile <- read.csv("meta.csv")
result <- fileValidation("data.csv", "meta.csv", ",", ",", datafile, metafile)
print(result)
} # }
